app.components.AnonymousPostingToggle.us: Users will be able to hide their identity from other users, project moderators and admins. These contributions can still be moderated.

All users will still need to comply with the requirements set in the Access Rights tab for their contributions to go through. User profile data will not be available on the participation data export.
Learn more about user anonymity in our {supportArticle}.

It is also possible to upload the filled-out surveys back to the platform. Our Offline Input Importer will automatically detect the handwriting on the forms. app.containers.Admin.projects.project.id: Unlock AI-powered summaries and ask questions about your project input.
I agree to using OpenAI as a data processor for this project
By continuing you agree to the using OpenAI as a data processor for this project.
The OpenAI APIs power the automated text summaries and parts of the automated tagging experience.
We only send what users wrote in their surveys, ideas and comments to the OpenAI APIs, never any information from their profile.
OpenAI will not use this data for further training of its models. More information on how OpenAI handles data privacy can be found {link}.

app.containers.Admin.tools.powerBIDescri: Use our plug & play Power BI Templates to access Citizenlab data in your Microsoft Power BI Workspace.
app.containers.Admin.tools.powerBIDisabl: Power BI is a Premium-only feature. Contact your GovSuccess Manager if you want more info on this.
app.containers.Admin.tools.powerBITempla: If you intend to use your CitizenLab data within a Power BI data flow, this template will allow you to set up a new data flow that connects to your CitizenLab data. Once you have downloaded this template you must first find and replace the following strings ##CLIENT_ID## and ##CLIENT_SECRET## in the template with your public API credentials before uploading to PowerBI.
Note: To use either of these Power BI templates, you must first {link}
create a set of credentials for our public API

This template will create a Power BI report based on your CitizenLab data. It will set up all the data connections to your CitizenLab platform, create the data model and some default dashboards. When you open the template in Power BI you will be prompted to enter your public API credentials. You will also need to enter the Base Url for your platform, which is: {baseUrl}
Further details about using your CitizenLab data in Power BI can be found in our {link}.
app.containers.Admin.tools.publicAPIDesc: Manage the credentials to create custom integrations on our public API.
app.containers.Admin.tools.publicAPIDisa: The public API is a Premium-only feature. Contact your GovSuccess Manager if you want more info on this.
app.containers.Admin.tools.widgetDescrip: You can create a widget, customize it and add it to your own website to attract people to this platform.
app.containers.Admin.tools.workshopsDesc: Hold live video meetings, facilitate simultaneous group discussions and debates. Gather input, vote and reach consensus, just like you would offline.

Use this setting if collecting name, last name, and answers to platform level demographic questions is important to you. It may increase the barrier for participation.

Responses to demographic questions will get stored in user profiles. Questions will only be asked to users who have not answered them before. Answers to these questions will also be accessible via the participation data export, which is accessible to both moderators and admins.
app.containers.AdminPage.projects.projec: Your text summaries will be displayed here, but you currently do not have any yet.
Click the Auto-summarize button above to get started.
Asking questions about fewer inputs leads to a higher accuracy. Reduce the current input selection by using tags, search or demographic filters.
Rate the quality of this insight
Summarizing fewer inputs leads to a higher accuracy. Reduce the current input selection by using tags, search or demographic filters.
Reduce the current input selection by using tags, search or demographic filters

Our platform enables you to explore the core themes, summarize the data, and examine various perspectives. If you are looking for specific answers or insights, consider using the "Ask a Question" feature to dive deeper beyond the summary.
While rare, the AI might occasionally generate information that was not explicitly present in the original dataset.
The AI might emphasize certain themes or ideas more than others, potentially skewing the overall interpretation.

Our system is optimized for handling 20-200 well-defined inputs for the most accurate results. As the volume of data increases beyond this range, the summary may become more high-level and generalized. This does not mean the AI becomes "less accurate", but rather that it will focus on broader trends and patterns. For more nuanced insights, we recommend using the (auto)-tagging feature to segment larger datasets into smaller, more manageable subsets.
We recommend using AI-generated summaries as a starting point for understanding large datasets, but not as the final word.
Do you want to automatically assign inputs to your tag?
There are different methods to automatically assign inputs to tags.
Use the auto-tag button to launch your preferred method.
Click on a tag to assign it to the currently selected input.
Auto-tags are automatically derived by the computer. You can change or remove them at all times.
Select maximum 9 tags you would like the inputs to be distributed between. Inputs already associated with these tags will not be classified again.
The classification is solely based on the name of the tag. Pick relevant keywords for the best results.
You create the tags and manually assign a few inputs as an example, the computer assigns the rest
Similar to "Tags: by label" but with increased accuracy as you’re training the system with good examples.
You create the tags, the computer assigns the inputs
This works well when you have a pre-defined set of tags or when your project has a limited scope in terms of tags.
Detect inputs with a significant dislikes/likes ratio
Select maximum 9 tags you would like the inputs to be distributed between.
The classification is based on the inputs currently assigned to the tags. The computer will try to follow your example.
The computer automatically detects tags and assigns them to your inputs.
Works well when your projects covers a broad range of tags. Good place to start.
How do you want to tag?
Detect the language of each input
Use tags to subdivide and filter the inputs, in order to make more accurate or targeted summaries.
Assign the existing platform tags that the author picked when posting
Assign a positive or negative sentiment to each input, derived from the text
What inputs do you want to tag?
The domicile chart is too large to display

app.modules.commercial.analytics.admin.c: The number of users who have participated in one or more project(s). Participants for polling and embedded surveys will not be counted here.
Percentage of all participants compared to all visitors.
Projects that are not archived and visible on the 'Active' table on the home page
All archived projects and active timeline projects that have finished are counted here
The number of projects that are visible on the platform
Proposals that have reached the required voting threshold
Percentage of all registrations compared to all visitors.
Only users who have accepted cookie tracking will be counted. Admins and project managers are not counted.

When the project filter is active, this shows the average duration of any visit that included the selected project. This counts the entire period a user was on the platform, not just the time spent on the selected project page(s).

When the project filter is active, this shows the average page views for any visit that included the selected project. This counts all pages that a user viewed during the visit, not just the selected project page(s).
"Visitors" is the number of unique visitors. If a person visits the platform multiple times, they are only counted once.
"Visits" is the number of sessions. If a person visited the platform multiple times, each visit is counted.
To view the full list of referrers, {referrerListButton}
Since December 2023 it's easier for users to reject cookies, which has a negative effect on perceived traffic.
